Accessibility

panorama

The panorama(img) method transforms images containing 360-degree content, such as maps or HDRIs, into immersive 3D backgrounds that surround your scene. This is similar to calling background(color); call panorama(img) before drawing your scene to create a 360-degree background from your image. It operates on the concept of sphere mapping, where the image is mapped onto an infinitely large sphere based on the angles of the camera.

To enable 360-degree viewing, either use orbitControl() or try changing the orientation of the camera to see different parts of the background.
